coreyhaines

Software Journeyman

I am project-oriented, behavior-driven, and fun-loving. I am well known in the Ruby community for actively promoting software craftmanship through my travels, speaking engagements, teaching, coderetreats, tweets, and interviews.

Blog

The Journeyman Tours

On the goals of Coderetreat

Last Sunday, I facilitated a coderetreat in Cleveland, Ohio, at the Leandog Software boat. It was a great time, filled with writing code, practicing technique and learning both obvious and subtle lessons. I'm always excited to see people's reactions about the event (for example, here and here), as they gain more insights into their journey. Over the past two years, I've found my own role as facilitator transform into a guide, poking a bit here and there at the code.

Cleveland Code Retreat Introduction from Corey Haines on Vimeo.

Coderetreats

2011 Tourdates

I intend to facilitate at least 10 code retreats around the country and the world. Along the way, I will do my best to share the formula, so that others can learn to facilitate their own. The more skilled facilitators there are, the more code retreats can be successfully run to their full potential. read more...

Other Projects

Katacasts

The Katacasts series consists of performance katas, done as screencasts, by Enrique Comba and me, Corey Haines. Special guest appearances are planned by others. The screencasts are released weekly, usually between Tuesday and Thursday.

"How I got Started" Interviews

During my initial pair-programming tour, I began the practice of interviewing my hosts and posting them to the journeyman blog. One of the questions I usually started with was 'how did you get started in this?' This is a question that I've asked people over the years, even before the tours, and I'm always fascinated by it. Once I started video-taping them, though, it really took off in my mind.
